TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit HttpCacheVaryByHeaders extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides a type-safe way to set the <xref:System.Web.HttpCachePolicy.VaryByHeaders%2A> property.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.HttpCachePolicy.VaryByHeaders%2A> property identifies which request header parameters ASP.NET uses to uniquely identify a variation of the response when there are multiple cached responses for a resource. This is useful when a response depends on a set of client inputs, such as headers or parameters.
The HttpCacheVaryByHeaders is not directly related to HTTP cache-control headers, but helps ensure that a client or proxy varies by the specified headers. For more information about `VaryByHeaders`, see RFC 2616: Hypertext Transfer Protocol -- HTTP/1.1, available on the [World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) Web site](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=37125). See section 14, "Header Field Definitions", for complete details.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the ASP.NET output cache varies the cached responses by the HTTP header, and appends it to the out-going HTTP header.
Docs.value: when the ASP.NET output cache varies by the header; otherwise, . The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `Vary` header indicates the request-header fields that the server varies the response by the `Accept` field and specifies that the server selects the response based on the media types acceptable to the client.
For more information on HTTP headers, see RFC 2616: Hypertext Transfer Protocol -- HTTP/1.1, available on the [World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) Web site](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=37125). See section 14, "Header Field Definitions", for complete details.
## Examples This following code example demonstrates how some action is performed only if the AcceptTypes property is `true`.
[!code-vb[Classic HttpCacheVaryByHeaders.AcceptTypes Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.httpcacheva_2_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[Classic HttpCacheVaryByHeaders.AcceptTypes Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.httpcacheva_2_1.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance string[] GetHeaders() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets an array of values which specify the HTTP headers to be used for varying the cache.
Docs.returns: An array of values which contain the HTTP headers for varying the cache.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool this[string header] { get; set; }

Docs.param: The name of the custom header.
Docs.summary: Gets or sets a custom header field that the ASP.NET output cache varies the cached responses by, and appends it to the out-going HTTP header.
Docs.value: when the ASP.NET output cache varies by the specified custom field; otherwise, . The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `Vary` header indicates the request-header fields that the server varies the response by.
For more information, see RFC 2616: Hypertext Transfer Protocol -- HTTP/1.1, available on the [World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) Web site](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=37125). See section 14, "Header Field Definitions", for complete details.
The <xref:System.Web.HttpCacheVaryByHeaders.VaryByUnspecifiedParameters%2A> method is called internally if the specified `header` has the value * (an asterisk).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void SetHeaders(string[] headers) cil managed

Docs.param: An array of values which contain the HTTP headers for varying the cache.
Docs.summary: Sets an array of values which specify the HTTP headers to be used for varying the cache.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the ASP.NET output cache varies the cached responses by the header, and appends it to the out-going HTTP header.
Docs.value: when the ASP.NET output cache varies by the header, and adds it to the HTTP header sent to the client; otherwise, . The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `Vary` header indicates the request-header fields that the server uses to determine which of multiple cached responses is sent in response to a client request. The `User-Agent` field specifies that the server selects the response based on the client's user-agent type.
For more information, see RFC 2616: Hypertext Transfer Protocol -- HTTP/1.1, available on the [World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) Web site](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=37125). See section 14, "Header Field Definitions", for complete details.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how some action is performed only if the UserAgent property is `true`.
[!code-vb[Classic HttpCacheVaryByHeaders.UserAgent Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.httpcacheva_0_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[Classic HttpCacheVaryByHeaders.UserAgent Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.httpcacheva_0_1.aspx)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the ASP.NET output cache varies the cached responses by the header, and appends it to the out-going HTTP header.
Docs.value: when the ASP.NET output cache varies by the header and adds it to the HTTP header sent to the client; otherwise, . The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `Vary` header indicates the request-header fields that the server uses to determine which of multiple cached responses is sent in response to a client request. The `Accept-CharSet` field specifies that the server selects the response based on the client's character set.
For more information, see RFC 2616: Hypertext Transfer Protocol -- HTTP/1.1, available on the [World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) Web site](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=37125). See section 14, "Header Field Definitions", for complete details.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how some action is performed only if the UserCharSet property is `true`.
[!code-cs[Classic HttpCacheVaryByHeaders.UserCharSet Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.httpcacheva_3_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[Classic HttpCacheVaryByHeaders.UserCharSet Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.httpcacheva_3_1.aspx)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the ASP.NET output cache varies the cached responses by the header, and appends it to the out-going HTTP header.
Docs.value: when ASP.NET output cache varies by the header and adds it to the HTTP header sent to the client; otherwise, . The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `Vary` header indicates the request-header fields that the server uses to determine which of multiple cached responses is sent in response to a client request. The `Accept-Language` field specifies that the server selects the response based on languages acceptable to the client.
For more information, see RFC 2616: Hypertext Transfer Protocol -- HTTP/1.1, available on the [World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) Web site](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=37125). See section 14, "Header Field Definitions", for complete details.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how some action is performed only if the UserLanguage property is `true`.
[!code-cs[Classic HttpCacheVaryByHeaders.UserLanguage Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.httpcacheva_4_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[Classic HttpCacheVaryByHeaders.UserLanguage Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.httpcacheva_4_1.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void VaryByUnspecifiedParameters() cil managed

Docs.summary: Causes ASP.NET to vary by all header values and sets the HTTP header to the value * (an asterisk). All other header information to be dropped.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `Vary` header indicates the request-header fields that the server uses to determine which of multiple cached responses is sent in response to a client request. The * value specifies that the server selects the response based on parameters not specified in request headers (for example, the network address of the client).
For more information, see RFC 2616: Hypertext Transfer Protocol -- HTTP/1.1, available on the [World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) Web site](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=37125). See section 14, "Header Field Definitions", for complete details.
